timeline.bodyText: I would suggest using InternalBiomeUtils.fromRawId similar to InternalBiomeUtils.getRawId so we can make them both use a DynamicRegistryManager if needed
timeline.author: CheaterCodes

replies.bodyText: Vanilla still uses Biomes.fromRawId itself in a place where a DynamicRegistryManager is unavailable, so this won't help.
replies.author: shartte

replies.bodyText:
You mean BiomeLayer.sample? I would've changed that too.
Dunno, to me that would feel better.
replies.author: CheaterCodes

timeline.bodyText:
I would suggest capturing the biomeRegistry in VanillaLayeredBiomeSource.<init> and use that one theoughout for the conversion RegistryKey <-> RawId. That should be compatible with using the DynamicRegistryManager then (and I think also json biomes).
We'd have to check if that capture covers all use cases, but I think it does.
timeline.author: CheaterCodes

replies.bodyText: This will still not fix the Vanilla logic that also accesses the raw-id mapping directly and thus just complicates the logic needlessly.
replies.author: shartte

timeline.bodyText:
This validation doesn't seem great to me. How does this interact with registering to DynamicRegistryManager.BUILTIN or using json biomes?
I'd suggest dropping this validation for the initial PR.
This seems like it could cause issues, and that's the last thing we want validation to do.
timeline.author: CheaterCodes

replies.bodyText: It doesn't interact with it. This API will be used by modders in their Mod initializers, when no dynamic registry manager exists. The only way to ensure only properly registered Biomes are used is to validate against the BuiltInRegistries, and follow the same general approach Vanilla does.
replies.author: shartte

timeline.bodyText: I would suggest using InternalBiomeUtils.fromRawId similar to InternalBiomeUtils.getRawId so we can make them both use a DynamicRegistryManager if needed.
timeline.author: CheaterCodes

timeline.bodyText: I would suggest using InternalBiomeUtils.fromRawId similar to InternalBiomeUtils.getRawId so we can make them both use a DynamicRegistryManager if needed.
timeline.author: CheaterCodes

timeline.bodyText: I would suggest using InternalBiomeUtils.fromRawId similar to InternalBiomeUtils.getRawId so we can make them both use a DynamicRegistryManager if needed.
timeline.author: CheaterCodes

timeline.bodyText: I would suggest... Ok, I think you get the point.
timeline.author: CheaterCodes
CheaterCodes

timeline.bodyText: Just gonna mention that I like my approach in my fork better, but this is probably fine too.
timeline.author: CheaterCodes

replies.bodyText: That might actually be better. I'll investigate adopting that approach.
replies.author: shartte

timeline.bodyText: I know you disagree, but I'm still gonna comment that I don't think we should use BuiltinRegistries, but DynamicRegistryManager.BUILTIN. We can easily provide a getter for that registry too.
timeline.author: CheaterCodes

replies.bodyText: Paired with #1052 this is the easiest to explain and safest approach of registering worldgen objects, since it is also very easy to follow through the code (and check against Vanilla's behavior)
replies.author: shartte

timeline.bodyText:
Would be nice if we could get this to work using json biomes, even if you think we shouldn't use those.
Putting this here cause it'd be part of the test mod.
timeline.author: CheaterCodes

replies.bodyText:
I don't think defining the same thing you could define with a constructor call in a JSON file justifies the added complexity for this API and everyone else involved. There is literally nothing else you gain from doing it in a JSON file.
Datapacks don't factor into this. You can still override biome definitions from data packs like you can with Vanilla biomes, and defining a new biome in a datapack ist pointless since the mod that calls this API could not know about it beforehand.
replies.author: shartte

timeline.bodyText: Please name the method, this just confuses me.
timeline.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText:
I am afraid to rename it :-|
I'll check out what the consequences of that are w.r.t. accessors.
replies.author: shartte
i509VCB

replies.bodyText: Will I have to name it fabric_xxyz in this case or does the accessor guarantee that conflicts are irrelevant still apply here?
replies.author: shartte

replies.bodyText: Very rarely you'll have a conflict, (key bindings v0 being a former example of this). Should be fine
replies.author: i509VCB

timeline.message:
Ported 1.16.1 biomes-api-v1 to 1.16.2.
Public API changes:
- Removed flagging biomes as suitable for player spawns since that is now handled in the Biome Builder.
- Changed API over to RegistryKey's, not because it's necessary, but because it is more ergonomic since Vanilla Biomes in BuiltInBiomes are now all exposed as keys, rather than instances.
Changed to CheaterCode's mixin for modifying the nether biomes, saving us one accessor.
Finished moving and updating of the module, added experimental markers.
Finished rename from biomes-v1 to biome-api-v1
Reverted memory settings in preparation for loom-0.5
